actions.committee: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

official_title: A bill to expand the calling time restrictions on telemarketing telephone calls to include the period from 5:30 p.m. to 7:30 p.m., and for other purposes.

summary.text: Family Dinnertime Protection Act of 2003 - Directs the Federal Trade Commission to modify telemarketing sales regulations to expand the calling time restrictions period for telemarketing telephone calls to the period between 5: 30 p.m. and 7: 30 p.m. local time.Requires the Commission to modify specified regulations in order to ensure that an outbound telephone call regarding suspicious or illegal activity in the account of a person does not constitute an abusive telemarketing act or practice.

titles.title: A bill to expand the calling time restrictions on telemarketing telephone calls to include the period from 5:30 p.m. to 7:30 p.m., and for other purposes.
